body_html:
@zyavrik I think eigen is downloaded from source in TensorFlow, not built against the installed library in your dev machine (libeigen3-dev) directly.

Installing libeigen3-dev may actually complicate the issue as there are mixed header files from different versions of eigen3 (one from downloaded source, another from the sys directory in your dev machine).

It is hard to see but from the limited information above, I tends to think the compiling error might be related to gcc version (or some #define in Eigen library).

Can you provide more details about the OS and GCC version?
body_text:
@zyavrik I think eigen is downloaded from source in TensorFlow, not built against the installed library in your dev machine (libeigen3-dev) directly.
Installing libeigen3-dev may actually complicate the issue as there are mixed header files from different versions of eigen3 (one from downloaded source, another from the sys directory in your dev machine).
It is hard to see but from the limited information above, I tends to think the compiling error might be related to gcc version (or some #define in Eigen library).
Can you provide more details about the OS and GCC version?
body:
@zyavrik I think eigen is downloaded from source in TensorFlow, not built against the installed library in your dev machine (libeigen3-dev) directly.

Installing libeigen3-dev may actually complicate the issue as there are mixed header files from different versions of eigen3 (one from downloaded source, another from the sys directory in your dev machine).

It is hard to see but from the limited information above, I tends to think the compiling error might be related to gcc version (or some `#define` in Eigen library).

Can you provide more details about the OS and GCC version?
